tephritis: <entryFree id="n47820" type="greek" key="tephri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tephrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tefri=tis,</foreign> <sense id="n47820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ashcolored precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 68, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tepidarius: <entryFree id="n47821" type="main" key="te^pi^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpĭdārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tepidus</etym>, <sense id="n47821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tepid water</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to a tepid bath.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47821.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aënum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CELLA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3328</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47821.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpĭdārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tepid bathing-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tepid bath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10</bibl>, §§ 1 and 5.</sense></entryFree>
tepide: <entryFree id="n47822" type="main" key="te^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tepidus <sense id="n47822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tepido: <entryFree id="n47823" type="hapax" key="te^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tepidus</etym>, <sense id="n47823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make lukewarm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tepid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 41, § 250</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tepidus: <entryFree id="n47824" type="main" key="te^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tepeo</etym>, <sense id="n47824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moderately warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lukewarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tepid</hi> (cf.: calidus, fervidus). </sense><sense id="n47824.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigidum aliquid et calidum novimus: inter utrumque tepidum est. Si tepido illi plus frigidi ingessero, fiet frigidum: si plus calidi affudero, fiet novissime calidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 21</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">calidus tepidusque vapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 858</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brumae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:646" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Notus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Berenicida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigia tepidiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 59, 79, § 163</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum hieme tepidissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 24</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47824.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, opp. to heat, ardor, <hi rend="ital">lukewarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cooled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidam recalescere mentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 629</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 225</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 19, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adflarant tepidae pectora vestra faces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 434</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">tepidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lukewarmly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47824.3" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 19</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 1, § 9</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n47824.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">without warmth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepidissime hoc dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tepor: <entryFree id="n47825" type="main" key="te^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gentle warmth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lukewarmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tepidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tepor</hi> (cf.: fervor, calor). </sense><sense id="n47825.1" n="I" level="1"> Opp. to cold (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">externus et adventicius tepor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 20, § 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus tepor, i. e. of spring,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 381" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(cupressus) alibi non nisi in tepore proveniens,</quote> <trans><tr>in a mild</tr>, <tr>moderate temperature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 60, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 50, 51, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:137" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 32, 59, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verno tepori similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepore febrium arescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 517</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47825.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">fomentations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19:120" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19, 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47825.3" n="II" level="1"> Opp. to warmth (very <cb n="TERE" /> rare). </sense><sense id="n47825.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">excepta vox est, cum teporem incusaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n47825.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">coldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languor</hi> of language: <cit><quote lang="la">libri eiusdem lentitudinis ac teporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
teporatus: <entryFree id="n47826" type="hapax" key="te^po_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tepor</etym>, <sense id="n47826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made moderately warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warmed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragmenta vitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 199</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
teporus: <entryFree id="n47827" type="main" key="te^po_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mild</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aequinoctium veris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. Solstit. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus Favonii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tepula: <entryFree id="n47828" type="main" key="te^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕpŭla ăqua</orth>, <sense id="n47828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stream of water</hi> (perh. tepid) <hi rend="ital">conducted to the Capitol at Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ter: <entryFree id="n47829" type="main" key="te^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕr</orth>, <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. tris; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tri/s;</foreign> cf. tres</etym>, <sense id="n47829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">three times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrice.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47829.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ter sub armis malim vitam cernere, quam semel modo parere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 297 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">haec rude misceto ter in die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 104, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter in anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter in anno audire nuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter aut quater die perfricari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is de se ter sortibus consultum dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter aevo functus senex (Nestor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ter amplus Geryon,</quote> <trans><tr>tripleheaded</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pepulisse Ter pede terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 16</bibl></cit>; 4, 1, 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:80" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter in annum tesseras dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl></cit> et saep.—With numerals: ter quattuor corpora, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 108</bibl> (Ann. v. 96 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ter quinquagenos sues habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terni ter cyathi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 14</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ter centena epigrammata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter centum milibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 116</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ter centum (by many written as one word, tercentum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 272</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter denis redeuntibus annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter denas vaccas Accipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:635" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter deno bove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:259" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter et viciens volneratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29, § 104</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47829.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., for an indefinite number, = <hi rend="ital">often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter sese attollens cubitoque annixa levavit: Ter revoluta toro est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 690</bibl></cit>: ter si resurgat murus aëneus, ter pereat meis Excisus Argivis; <cit><quote lang="la">ter uxor Capta virum puerosque ploret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:65 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 65 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneam magnā ter voce vocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:873" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 873</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 26 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter tanto pejor ipsa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos apparat ... stulte bis terque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bis terque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 358</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">440</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:517 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 517 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bisque terque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:82:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 82, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terque quaterque manu pectus percussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 155</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terque quaterque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter et quater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47829.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, to denote a high degree: <cit><quote lang="la">felices ter et amplius, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o ego ter felix, si, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>thrice happy</tr>, <tr>thrice fortunate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o terque quaterque beati!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o mihi felicem terque quaterque diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:26" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
teramon: <entryFree id="n47830" type="greek" key="te^ra^mo_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrămōn</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tĕrămum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tera/mwn,</foreign> <sense id="n47830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant growing near Philippi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terbentinus: <entryFree id="n47831" type="main" key="te^rbenti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrbentĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. terebinthinus <sense id="n47831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tercentum: <entryFree id="n47832" type="main" key="tercentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tercentum</orth>, <sense id="n47832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">three hundred</hi>, v. ter.</sense></entryFree>
terdecies: <entryFree id="n47833" type="main" key="terde^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ter-dĕcĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭens</orth>, <pos>adv. num.</pos>, <sense id="n47833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thirteen times</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem circulum luna terdecies in duodecim mensibus percurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respirare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS. terdeciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">binas terdecies, semel quaternas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>thirty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terdeni: <entryFree id="n47834" type="main" key="terde_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terdēni</orth>, <itype>better separately</itype>, v. ter and deni.</entryFree>
terebinthinus: <entryFree id="n47835" type="greek" key="te^re^binthi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrĕbinthĭnus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrbentĭnus</orth> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 54, 4</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">terebi/nqinos,</foreign> <sense id="n47835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the terebinth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turpentine-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 22, § 35</bibl> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">tabula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terebinthizusa: <entryFree id="n47836" type="greek" key="te^re^binthi_zu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrĕbinthīzūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">terebinqizousa,</foreign> <sense id="n47836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turpentine-colored precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terebinthus: <entryFree id="n47837" type="greek" key="te^re^binthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrĕbinthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tere/binqos,</foreign> <sense id="n47837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the terebinth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turpentine-tree</hi>: Pistacia terebinthus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:27" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 18, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terebra: <entryFree id="n47838" type="main" key="te^re_^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrē^bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n47838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕ-rē^brum</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 12, 44, 12 al.</bibl>) [tero]. </sense><sense id="n47838.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument for boring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a borer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an auger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gimlet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 41, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:15 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 15 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:116" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 15, 25, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:200" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 13, 76, § 200</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47838.2" n="II" level="1"> As a surgical <pb n="1858" /> <cb n="TERE" /> instrument, <hi rend="ital">a trephine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47838.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A military engine for boring through walls in sieges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terebramen: <entryFree id="n47839" type="hapax" key="te^re_^bra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrē^brāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>terebro</etym>, <sense id="n47839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hole bored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furfuracea tinearum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terebratio: <entryFree id="n47840" type="main" key="te^re_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrē^brātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n47840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">a boring.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47840.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:12" default="NO">5, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 26</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47840.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a hole bored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 13</bibl></sense></entryFree>
terebratus: <entryFree id="n47841" type="hapax" key="te^re_^bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrē^brātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boring</hi>, Scrib Comp 206.</sense></entryFree>
terebro: <entryFree id="n47842" type="main" key="te^re_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrē^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ătum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>terebra</etym>, <sense id="n47842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bore through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perforate</hi> (not in Cic.; syn.: foro, perforo) </sense><sense id="n47842.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terebrā vitem pertundito...artitoque eā quā terebraveris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites Gallicā terebrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa (capitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 52 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavas uteri latebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2</bibl></cit>. 38: <cit><quote lang="la">telo lumen acuto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxum per rara foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:697" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmā terebratā, Vitr 9, 9: vitem in oblicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 25, § 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gryllus quoniam terram terebret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 39, § 138</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47842.2" n="B" level="2"> Transt., <hi rend="ital">to bore out</hi>: regustatum digito terebrare salinum Contentus perages, <hi rend="ital">to bore out</hi> the salt-dish with the fingers; <cit><quote lang="la">to hunt out the last grain,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:138" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 138</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47842.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make by boring</hi>: foramen, Vitr 10, 16, 5. — </sense><sense id="n47842.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to insinuate one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to coax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 82</bibl>; so perh. also, id Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. subscudes, p. 306 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
terebrum: <entryFree id="n47843" type="main" key="te^re^brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrĕbrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. terebra <sense id="n47843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
teredo: <entryFree id="n47844" type="greek" key="te^re_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">terhdw/n,</foreign> <sense id="n47844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worm</hi> that gnaws wood, clothing, etc., <hi rend="ital">a wood fretter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 41, 80, § 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 6</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:197:23:7:70:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 197, 23, 7, 70, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:264" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 20, 81, § 264</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teredon: <entryFree id="n47845" type="main" key="Te^re_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrēdon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:28:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32</bibl>. § 145.</sense></entryFree>
tereides: <entryFree id="n47846" type="main" key="Te_re^i^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tērĕĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Tereus.</entryFree>
terensis: <entryFree id="n47847" type="main" key="Terensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Terensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. dea) [tero], <sense id="n47847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess that presides over threshing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4</bibl>, p 131.</sense></entryFree>
terentianus: <entryFree id="n47848" type="main" key="Te^renti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrentĭānus</orth>, v. Terentius, B.</entryFree>
terentillns: <entryFree id="n47849" type="main" key="Terentillns"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Terentillns</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n47849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, e g C Terentillus Arsa, <hi rend="ital">author of the</hi> lex Terentilla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
terentinus: <entryFree id="n47850" type="main" key="Te^renti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Terentus.</entryFree>
terentius: <entryFree id="n47851" type="main" key="Te^renti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrentĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Terence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens </sense><sense id="n47851.1" n="1" level="3"> P. Terentius After, <hi rend="ital">the celebrated comic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born at Carthage</hi> A. U. C. 569, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 35, 1</bibl>; Suet. Vit. Ter.—</sense><sense id="n47851.2" n="2" level="3"> M. Terentius Varro, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated schotar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an elder contemporary and friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47851.3" n="3" level="3"> C. Terentius Varro, <hi rend="ital">Roman general at Cannœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, Terentia, <hi rend="ital">the wife of Cicero.</hi> — Hence, </sense><sense id="n47851.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕ-rentĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Terentius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Terentian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terentia et Cassia lex frumentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 52</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47851.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrentĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Terence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Terentian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chremes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>occurring in the poet Terence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, Phormio, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terentianus ipse se puniens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Heautontimoroumenos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Tusc. 3:27:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Lael. 24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>commanded by M Terentius Varro</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:32:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 32, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47851.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕ-rentilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> of Terentia, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47851.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrentĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> L. Terentianus Maurus, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian at the close of the first century after Christ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a metrical work.</hi></sense></entryFree>
terentus: <entryFree id="n47852" type="main" key="Te^rentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrentus or -os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place at the extremity of the</hi> Campus Martius, <hi rend="ital">on the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the</hi> Ludi Saeculares <hi rend="ital">were held</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:501" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 501</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:70:2:4:1:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 70, 2, 4, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:63:3" default="NO">10, 63, 3</bibl>; Fest pp. 350 and 351 Müll. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Terentus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Terentine</hi>: ludi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the secular games</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 17, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 54</bibl>; S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 35</bibl></cit> (al. Tarentinus).</sense></entryFree>
teres: <entryFree id="n47853" type="main" key="te^re^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕrĕs</orth>, <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tero; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/rhn,</foreign> tender</etym>, <sense id="n47853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rounded off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-turned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">teres est in longitudine rotundatum, quales asseres natura ministrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl></cit> Müll. (class.; syn. rotundus). </sense><sense id="n47853.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cb n="TERG" />mucro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 665</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fundae) habena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 579</bibl></cit>.—Of parts of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <trans><tr>round</tr>, <tr>slender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 35</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 633</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachiolum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 181</bibl></cit>. surae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 21</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 622</bibl></cit>, hence, of the form: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 28</bibl></cit>.—Of other objects: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <trans><tr>tightly twisted</tr>, <tr>firmly woven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit> strophium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">zona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:320" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iaspis, Claud Rapt. Pros. 2, 40: catena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 185</bibl></cit>: coma, <hi rend="ital">curling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">curly</hi>, Varr. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 328, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47853.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegani</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sapiens) teres atque rotundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 86</bibl></cit>, imitated by <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atticorum aures teretes et religiosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teretes aures intellegensque judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox in disputationibus,</quote> <trans><tr>smooth</tr>, <tr>without impediment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio plena, sed tamen teres,</quote> <trans><tr>rounded off</tr>, <tr>polished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceroni mollius teretiusque visum est, fretu scribere quam freto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> seem not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
tereses: <entryFree id="n47854" type="main" key="Tereses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tereses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Spain</hi>, Plin 3, 1, 3, § 14.</sense></entryFree>
tereus: <entryFree id="n47855" type="main" key="Te_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēreus</orth>, <itype>ĕi or ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*threu/s.</foreign> <sense id="n47855.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Procne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the sister of Philomela</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whom he violated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 45" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:629" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 629</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:497:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 497, 6</bibl>. 615; 6, 635; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:75:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 75, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tērĕĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the offspring of Tereus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">his son Itys</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:436" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 436</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47855.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a tragedy by Attius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tergedum: <entryFree id="n47856" type="main" key="Tergedum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tergedum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tergeminus: <entryFree id="n47857" type="main" key="terge^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ter-gĕmĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. trigeminus.</entryFree>
tergenus: <entryFree id="n47858" type="main" key="terge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ter-gĕnus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n47858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a threefold kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi> (late Lat.): bumana efficiunt habitacula tergenus artes. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tergeo: <entryFree id="n47859" type="main" key="tergeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergeo</orth> or less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">tergo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 2 or 3</itype> (v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 423 sq.; <sense id="n47859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> tertus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 7</bibl> and 8), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>for stergo; akin to stringo; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">straggeu/w,</foreign> to twist</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to rub off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wipe off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wipe dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wipe clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleanse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47859.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. verro): numquam concessavimus Lavari aut fricari aut tergeri aut ornari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: mantelium, ubi manus terguntur, Varr L. L. 6, § 85 Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frontem sudario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares in adversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas,</quote> <trans><tr>to dry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequatam (mensam) mentae tersere virentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars leves clipeos et spicula lucida tergent,</quote> <trans><tr>rub off</tr>, <tr>polish</tr>, <tr>burnish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leve argentum, vasa aspera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manuque simul velut lacrimantia tersit Lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 48, 108, § 258</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aridus unde aures terget sonus ille,</quote> <trans><tr>grates upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila caeli (Aurora),</quote> <trans><tr>to scatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:136" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergere palatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to tickle the palate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: qui tractant ista, qui tergunt, qui ungunt, qui verrunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si QVIS TERGERE ORNARE REFICERR VOLET (sc. aram),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2489</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47859.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to improve</tr>, <tr>amend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <trans><tr>to expiate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 907" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 907</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">wiped off</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">clean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neat</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n47859.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulier) lauta, tersa, ornata, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pa. 1, 2, 31</bibl>; cf.: alii sunt circumtonsi et tersi atque unctuli, Varr. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 736</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tersum diem pro sereno dictum ab antiquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl></cit> Müll. — </sense><sense id="n47859.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terse</hi>: judicium acre tersumque. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tersum ac limatum esse oportet quod libris dedicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegiae tersus atque elegans auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 93</bibl></cit>; of in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo est tersior ac purus magis (Horatius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus tersum, molle, jucundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praefationes tersae, graciles, dulces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir in judicio litterarum tersissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2 praef.</bibl></cit>—No <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
tergeste: <entryFree id="n47860" type="main" key="Tergeste"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tergeste</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the northernmost town on the coast of Istria</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Trieste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 4</bibl>. —Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tergestum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 13</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tergestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> <cb n="TERG" /> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tergeste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tergestine.</hi> sinus, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Golfo di Trieste</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 127</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur subst.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tergestīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tergeste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Terges tines</hi>, Hirt B G 8, 24.</sense></entryFree>
tergilla: <entryFree id="n47861" type="hapax" key="tergilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tergum</etym>, <sense id="n47861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sward</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rind of pork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 3</bibl>; cf.: ter gilla sive tergillum <foreign lang="greek">fori/nh, xoiron de/rma</foreign> Gloss Philox.</sense></entryFree>
terginum: <entryFree id="n47862" type="main" key="tergi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, n. [id.], <sense id="n47862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raw-hide</hi>, as a scourge, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 414, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vostrum durius tergum erit quam terginum hot meum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tergiversanter: <entryFree id="n47863" type="main" key="tergi^versanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergĭversanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tergiversor <sense id="n47863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tergiversatio: <entryFree id="n47864" type="main" key="tergi^versa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergĭversātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tergiversor</etym>, <sense id="n47864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a declining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refusing; a shift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subterfuge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tergiversation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo erat morae et ter giversationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergiversationem istam probo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; Auct B Afr 8, 4.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tergiversator: <entryFree id="n47865" type="main" key="tergiversa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergiversātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who delays</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declines</hi>, o <hi rend="ital">hangs back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a boggler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laggard</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 247</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 10, 271</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tergiversatorius: <entryFree id="n47866" type="main" key="tergi^versa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergĭversātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym> <sense id="n47866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shuffing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evasiv</hi> (late Lat.): defensio, Aug Gest. c. Emer. 11.</sense></entryFree>
tergiversor: <entryFree id="n47867" type="main" key="tergi^versor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergĭ-versor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n47867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [ter gum], <hi rend="ital">to turn one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s back;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to decline refuse; to boggle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shuffle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seek a shift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eva sion; to shift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tergiversate</hi> (a favorite word of Cicero; <cit><quote lang="la">otherwise rare): itaque eam ter giversari non sinent secumque rapient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an cuncter et tergiverser, ut lis me dem, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid taces? quid dissimulas? quid tergiversaris?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Planc 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc aestuantem et tergiversantem judicio ille persequitur, id Fl. 20, 47. Fannius invitus et huc atque il luc tergiversans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:16:5:3" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 16, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tergiversamur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Tusc 3:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc 3, 18, 41</bibl></cit> in his tribus generibus non incal lide tergiversantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Off. 3:33:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est locus ad tergiversandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Att. 7:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules ipsos tergiversari, Liv 2, 23, 13: movebant consulem haec, sed tergiversari res cogebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:2:27:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: accusatores aut ca lumniantur aut praevaricantur aut tergi versantur...Tergiversari, in universum ab accusatione desistere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 16, 1</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tergiversanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">back wardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reluctantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:9:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tergo: <entryFree id="n47868" type="main" key="tergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. tergeo.</entryFree>
tergoro: <entryFree id="n47869" type="hapax" key="tergo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergŏro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tergus</etym>, <sense id="n47869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover cover over</hi> with any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">sues luto se ter gorantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 52, 78, § 212</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tergum: <entryFree id="n47870" type="main" key="tergum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose also <orth extent="full" lang="la">tergus</orth>, ŏris), <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n47870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiarem tergum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 227, 23</bibl>) [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tra/xhlos,</foreign> neck; perh. root <foreign lang="greek">tre/xw,</foreign> to run], <hi rend="ital">the back</hi> of men or beasts (syn. dor sum). </sense><sense id="n47870.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47870.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form tergum: <cit><quote lang="la">dabitur pol supplicium mihi de tergo vestre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vae illis virgis miseris quae hodie in tergo morientur meo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt 3, 4, 117</bibl></cit>: manibus ad tergum rejectis, Asin ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum terga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N D. 2, 63, 159</bibl></cit>; cf. tergo poenae pendere <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergo ac capite puniri, Liv 3, 55, 14.—Of cranes eaeque in tergo praevolantium Colla reponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2</bibl></cit> 49, 125. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of the dolphin, Ov F 2, 113.— Of the crocodile: ejus terga cataphracta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47870.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form tergus aurea quam molli tergore vexit ovis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26</bibl> (3, 21), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">ut equa facilem sui tergoris ascensum praebeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47870.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47870.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The back</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hinder part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rear</hi>, </sense><sense id="n47870.6" n="1" level="3"> Esp. in the phrases terga vertere or dare, <hi rend="ital">to turn the back</hi>, pregn., for <hi rend="ital">to take to flight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flee</hi>: omnes hostes terga verterunt; <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius fugere destiterunt, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terga vertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; 3, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and even of a single person: terga vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 22:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plures simul terga dederant, etc., Liv 22, 29, 5: terga dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:36:38:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 36, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter duas acies Etrusci, cum in vicem his atque illis terga darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:51:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 51, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga fugae praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:706" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga praestare (fugae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Agr 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:75" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 75</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> jam felicior aetas Terga dedit, tremuloque gradu venit aegra senectus, Ov M. 14, 143.—</sense><sense id="n47870.7" n="2" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">inflexo mox dare terga genu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>yield to the burden</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 6: praebere Phoebo <pb n="1859" /> <cb n="TERM" /> terga, <hi rend="ital">to sun itself</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 715</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrit ex insidiis versisque in Lucretium Etruscis terga caedit,</quote> <trans><tr>the rear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga Parthorum dicam,</quote> <trans><tr>the flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terga vincentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summi plena jam margine libri Scriptus et in tergo necdum finitus Orestes,</quote> <trans><tr>written on the back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:6" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro atque a tergo,</quote> <trans><tr>behind one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:24:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 24, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a tergo, a fronte, a lateribus tenebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a tergo Milonem adorirentur,</quote> <trans><tr>behind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 5, 38, § 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum hostilem a tergo accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 58, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B. G 7, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8:27" default="NO">3, 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:1" default="NO">8, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post tergum hostium legionem ostenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nostros post tergum adorirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germani post tergum clamore audito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post tergum hostem relinquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jam post terga reliquit Sexaginta annos,</quote> <trans><tr>has left behind him</tr>, <tr>has passed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia jam diutino bello exhausta post tergum sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae post tergum erant, strata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot amnibus montibusque post tergum objectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47870.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The back</hi> of any thing spread out horizontally, as land or water, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the surface</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">proscisso quae suscitat aequore terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:82" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 338</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 564</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:341" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 341</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47870.9" n="C" level="2"> (Pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">The body</hi> of an animal (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n47870.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Form tergum: <cit><quote lang="la">(serpens) Squamea convolvens sublato pectore terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 426</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a serpent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 208</bibl></cit>; Petr 89; <cit><quote lang="la">of Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrentia centum Terga suum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a hundred head of swine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 635</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrantis terga juvencos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetui tergo bovis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 183</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47870.11" n="(b)" level="5"> Form tergus: <cit><quote lang="la">resecat de tergore (suis) partem,</quote> <trans><tr>of a chine of bacon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diviso tergore (juvenci),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalenti tergore serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:209" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 209</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47870.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The covering of the back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the skin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leather</hi>, etc. (in this signif. tergus freq. occurs; syn.: pellis, corium). </sense><sense id="n47870.13" n="(a)" level="5"> Form tergum: <cit><quote lang="la">taurino quantum possent circumdare tergo,</quote> <trans><tr>ox-hide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre novae nares taurorum terga recusant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 655</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47870.14" n="(b)" level="5"> Form tergus: <cit><quote lang="la">tergora deripiunt costis et viscera nudant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 211</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durissimum dorso tergus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 53, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47870.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thing made of hide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leather.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47870.16" n="(a)" level="5"> Form tergum: venti bovis inclusi tergo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in a bag made of a bull</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 305</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et feriunt molles taurea terga manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tymbals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:342" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 342</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:212" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idae terga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:221" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsant terga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 2, 154</bibl></cit>: rupit Terga novena boum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the nine thicknesses of bull</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum Sulmonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 412</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 482</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 718</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence even: per linea terga (scuti),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 784</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection): <cit><quote lang="la">duroque intendere bracchia tergo, i. e. cestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 403</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 419</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47870.17" n="(b)" level="5"> Form tergus: <cit><quote lang="la">gestasset laevā taurorum tergora septem,</quote> <trans><tr>a shield covered with seven layers of hide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martis tergus Geticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tergus: <entryFree id="n47871" type="main" key="tergus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tergus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, v. tergum.</entryFree>
terina: <entryFree id="n47872" type="main" key="Te^ri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the Bruttian territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕrīnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Terina</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Gulf of Santa Eufemia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Elysius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terjugus: <entryFree id="n47873" type="main" key="terju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ter-jŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jugum</etym>, <sense id="n47873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thrice bound together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threefold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia,</quote> <trans><tr>three thousand</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 181, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
termen: <entryFree id="n47874" type="main" key="termen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. terminus <sense id="n47874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
termentum: <entryFree id="n47875" type="main" key="termentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <sense id="n47875.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">termentum pro eo, quod nunc dicitur detrimentum, utitur Plautus in Bacchidibus (4, 9, 5),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Plaut. l. l. Ritschl.</sense></entryFree>
termes: <entryFree id="n47876" type="main" key="terme^s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tero</etym>, <sense id="n47876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bough cut off</hi> from the olive-tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:45" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the palm-tree,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:9:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inculto termite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">termes ramus desectus ex arbore nec foliis repletus, ac nimis glaber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n47877" type="main" key="termes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termes</orth>, v. tarmes.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47878" type="main" key="Termes3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Termes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*te/rmes,</foreign> <sense id="n47878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Spain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lerma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Termestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Termes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4</bibl>, <cb n="TERM" /> 45.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Termestīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Termes</hi>, Epit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 54</bibl> Drak. —</sense><sense id="n47878.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
