termessus: <entryFree id="n47879" type="main" key="Termessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Termessus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*termhsso/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Pisidia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Karabunar Kini</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Termessenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Termessus</hi>, Liv. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
terminalis: <entryFree id="n47880" type="main" key="termi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terminus</etym>. <sense id="n47880.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to boundaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundary-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terminal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Jejun. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagarum terminalium accolae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47880.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Termĭna-lĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Terminus</hi> (the god of boundaries), held on the 23d of Feb., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 13</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:639 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 639 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 11, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 44, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Persec. 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47880.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">final</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concluding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <trans><tr>final decision</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 31, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuba,</quote> <trans><tr>announcing the conclusion of the play</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o (littera),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at the end of the word</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
terminate: <entryFree id="n47881" type="main" key="termi^na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭnātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. termino <sense id="n47881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
terminatio: <entryFree id="n47882" type="main" key="termi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>termino</etym>, <sense id="n47882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixing of bounds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limits.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47882.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 197, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">198, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47882.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fixing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determining</hi> (Ciceronian): <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (verborum) descriptus ordo alias aliā terminatione concluditur,</quote> <trans><tr>arrangement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtica et versus inventus est terminatione aurium,</quote> <trans><tr>determination</tr>, <tr>decision</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 53, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exposita terminatio rerum expetendarum, cur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terminator: <entryFree id="n47883" type="main" key="termi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who limits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sets bounds</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 11.</sense></entryFree>
terminatus: <entryFree id="n47884" type="gloss" key="termi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boundary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, Lex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
termino: <entryFree id="n47885" type="main" key="termi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>terminus</etym>, <sense id="n47885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to set bounds to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark off by boundaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi> (class.; syn.: finio, definio). </sense><sense id="n47885.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra mare et contra mare terras terminat omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1000" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1000</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum alter fines vestri imperii non terrae sed caeli regionibus terminaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, quem oleae terminabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (lituo) regiones vineae terminavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus palato extremo atque intimo terminatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars prior (togae) mediis cruribus optime terminatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:139" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 139</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum publicum a privato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3260</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(praetores) terminari jussi, quā ulterior citeriorve provincia servaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam qui terminet astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 287</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47885.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set limits to; to circumscribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">define</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isdem finibus gloriam, quibus vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus regionibus vitae spatium circumscriptum est, eisdem omnes cogitationes suas terminare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem possessionum Janiculo et Alpibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonos vocis paucis litterarum notis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ipsa natura divitias, quibus contenta sit et parabiles et terminatas habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">victu atque cultu terminatur pecuniae modus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum magnitudinis et diuturnitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:19:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Epicurus) bona voluptate terminaverit, mala dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam voluptatem omnis privatione doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (lingua) vocem fingit et terminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut subjectos campos terminare oculis haud facile queas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reach the limits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam tantam futuram, ut terminari nullo tempore oblivione possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prooemia intra quattuor sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47885.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set bounds to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam numerose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:199" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausulas longa syllaba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 183</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pariter extrema terminentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, unde est orsa, in eo terminetur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, ut Maecenas, etc., dicerentur, genitivo casu non e litterā sed tis syllabā terminarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam imperio annuo terminato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si negotium terminatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:58" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:230" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:40" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭnātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with limits</hi>, Auct. Cas. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Goes. p. 243.</sense></entryFree>
terminus: <entryFree id="n47886" type="main" key="termi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">termo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl> Müll., or Ann. v. 470 and 471 Vahl.; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">termen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <cb n="TERO" /> <gen>n.</gen>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 21</bibl> Müll.; so, <sense id="n47886.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">(BTERMINA DVO STANT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3121</bibl></cit>) [Sanscr. root tar-, overcome; tīrain, shore, edge; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/rma,</foreign> goal; <foreign lang="greek">te/rmwn,</foreign> border; cf. trans, in-trare], <hi rend="ital">a boundary-line</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi> (syn.: finis, limes, meta). </sense><sense id="n47886.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of local boundaries: <cit><quote lang="la">contentio de terminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 24</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandria, in terminis Africae et Aegypti condita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—Comically, = membrum virile, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 146, 24</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 126 Rib.).— Hence, </sense><sense id="n47886.2" n="B" level="2"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Termĭnus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the deity presiding over boundaries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:639 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 639 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:10:22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 54, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:27" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=368" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 368</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 448</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47886.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">term</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituendi sunt, qui sint in amicitiā fines, ut quasi termini diligendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certos mihi fines terminosque constituam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris facultatem non illius artis terminis, sed ingeni sui finibus describere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis terminis circumscribere aut definire jus suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius, cujus res gestae atque virtutes isdem quibus solis cursus regionibus ac terminis continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium aetatum certus est terminus, senectutis autem nullus est certus terminus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pangere terminos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">termini egestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos terminos dignitati statuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 29, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
termiteus: <entryFree id="n47887" type="hapax" key="termi^te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termĭtĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>termes</etym>, <sense id="n47887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an olive-branch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <trans><tr>an olive-branch</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 446</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
termo: <entryFree id="n47888" type="main" key="termo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">termo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. terminus <sense id="n47888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ternarius: <entryFree id="n47889" type="main" key="terna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ternārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terni</etym>, <sense id="n47889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consisting of three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ternary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47889.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of three feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11 praef.</bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n47889.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ternārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, for triens, <hi rend="ital">a third of an</hi> as, Pelag. Vet. 16.</sense></entryFree>
terni: <entryFree id="n47890" type="main" key="terni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n47890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi> [ter]. </sense><sense id="n47890.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">three each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea partes habet novem discretas, ter ternas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terni ter cyathi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in jugera singula ternis medimnis decidere liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 114</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ternae sunt utriusque partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:60:201" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 60, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muneraque in naves ternos optare juvencos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ternūm pedum longitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 29, 35, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ternūm digitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 17, 73, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 6, 30, § 66</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">intervallo ternorum pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 67, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pariunt terna ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">terno consurgunt ordine remi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Gratia terna afflavit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the three Graces</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren. 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47890.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for tres, <hi rend="ital">three</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ternas (litteras)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres equitum numero turmae ternique vagantur Ductores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:112" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terna guttura monstri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immane est vitium, dare milia terna macello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter terna, quae sunt novem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ternideni: <entryFree id="n47891" type="hapax" key="ternide_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terni-dēni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype>, <sense id="n47891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. distr. adj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirteen each</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ternadena ova subicito aestate totā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 62, § 231</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ternio: <entryFree id="n47892" type="main" key="terni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ternĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>terni</etym>, <sense id="n47892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number three</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ternion</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">tria/s,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 775</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ternox: <entryFree id="n47893" type="hapax" key="ternox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ter-nox</orth>, <itype>noctis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a threefold night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculea,</quote> <trans><tr>in which Hercules was begotten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:301" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 301</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ternus: <entryFree id="n47894" type="main" key="ternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. terni.</entryFree>
tero: <entryFree id="n47895" type="main" key="te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi, trītum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n47895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> terii, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 220</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. tristi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 30</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root ter; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tei/rw, tru/w, tri/bw,</foreign> to rub; cf. Lat. tribulare, triticum; akin to <foreign lang="greek">te/rhn,</foreign> tender, Lat. teres</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to rub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rub to pieces; to bruise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">triturate</hi> (syn.: frico, tundo, pinso). </sense><sense id="n47895.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n47895.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: num me illuc ducis, ubi lapis lapidem terit? (i. e. <hi rend="ital">into a mill</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimulam oculos terendo vix vi exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teritur lignum ligno ignemque concipit attritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:40:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 77</bibl></cit>. § 208: sed nihil hederā praestantius quae <pb n="1860" /> <cb n="TERO" /> teritur, lauro quae terat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in mortario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 10, 22, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in farinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacam trapetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguibus herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes in stipite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:369" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucina trita redolent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:64:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 64, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piper,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appia trita rotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum in ventre,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to digest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> — <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poet</orth>.: labellum calamo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to rub one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s lip</hi> (in playing), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcemque terit jam calce Diores,</quote> <trans><tr>treads upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystalla labris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 23, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47895.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47895.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To rub</hi> grain from the ears <hi rend="ital">by treading</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia frumenti tua triverit area centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">area dum messes teret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teret area culmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 192</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut patria careo, bis frugibus area trita est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it has twice been harvest-time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47895.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cleanse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beautify by rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furbish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharpen</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">polio, acuo): oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura mordaci pumice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc radios trivere rotis,</quote> <trans><tr>smoothed</tr>, <tr>turned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 444</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitrum torno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 66, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catillum manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritus cimice lectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:33:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 33, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47895.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lessen by rubbing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rub away; to wear away by use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wear out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(navem) ligneam, saepe tritam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (tempus) rigidas silices, hoc adamanta terit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6</bibl></cit>. 14: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to dull</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucronem rubigine silicem liquore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit> (3, 20), 15: <cit><quote lang="la">trita labore colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trita subucula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trita vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to read often</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:3:4" default="NO">11, 3, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid haberet, Quod legeret tereretque viritim publicus usus?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula labris patrum trita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:12:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: ut illum di terant, qui primum olitor caepam protulit, <hi rend="ital">crush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annihilate</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 681</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n47895.7" n="4" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be employed in. occupied with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos qui in foro verisque litibus terimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 10:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47895.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To tread often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to visit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequent</hi> a way or place (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">calco, calcito): angustum formica terens iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter propositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30</bibl></cit> (3, 28), 14: <cit><quote lang="la">Appiam mannis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:927" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 927</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via trita pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:13:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulator porticum terit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea nocturnis trita fenestra dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">nec jam clarissimorum virorum receptacula habitatore servo teruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:50:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 50, 3</bibl></cit>: flavaeque terens querceta Maricae Liris, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr 259. —</sense><sense id="n47895.9" n="6" level="3"> In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bojus est, Bojam terit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl> (4. 10), 30; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 87</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47895.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (freq. in good prose). </sense><sense id="n47895.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To wear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi> time; usu. <hi rend="ital">to waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend in dissipation</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">absumo, consumo): teritur dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem sermone terere segnities merast,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves diem trivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 27, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus in convivio luxuque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 57, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus ibi in secreto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem aetatem in his discendis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:31:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 31, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teretur interea tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam alteram aetatem bellis civilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne aevum ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe otia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium conviviis comissationibusque inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47895.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To expend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui operam teri frustra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 12, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47895.13" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To exert greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in opere longinquo sese tererent, Liv 6, 8, 10: ut in armis terant plebem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 27, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47895.14" n="D" level="2"> Of language, <hi rend="ital">to wear out by use</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to render common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonplace</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">trite</hi> (in <hi rend="ital">verb finit.</hi> very rare, but freq. as a <pos>P. a.</pos>): <cit><quote lang="la">jam hoc verbum satis hesterno sermone trivimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (nomina) nunc consuetudo diurna trivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n47895.15" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To tread under foot</hi>, i. e. to <hi rend="ital">injure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">violate</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">jurata deorum majestas teritur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 228</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trītus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n47895.16" n="A" level="2"> Prop. of a road or way, <hi rend="ital">oft-trodden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frequented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:281" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 81, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrijugi spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 167</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritissima quaeque via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 1, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47895.17" n="B" level="2"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n47895.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Practised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritas aures habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:32:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 32, 124</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritiores manūs ad aedificandum perficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47895.19" n="2" level="3"> Of language, <hi rend="ital">used often</hi> <cb n="TERR" /> or <hi rend="ital">much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">familiar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commonplace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in Graeco sermone tam tritum atque celebratum est, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen minus tritum sermone nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:29:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 29, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo illud: summum jus summā injuriā factum est jam tritum sermone proverbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciamus tractando usitatius hoc verbum ac tritius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compedes, quas induere aureas mos tritior vetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terpsichore: <entryFree id="n47896" type="main" key="Terpsi^cho^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Terpsĭchŏrē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*teryixo/rh,</foreign> <sense id="n47896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Muse of dancing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 20, 5</bibl>; hence, in gen., for <hi rend="ital">Muse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Terpsichoren odit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terra: <entryFree id="n47897" type="main" key="terra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terra</orth> (archaic <orth extent="full" lang="la">tera</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:4:21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 4, 21</bibl>), ae (<sense id="n47897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> terras, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.: terraï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 7</bibl> ib. (Ann. v. 479 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:251" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1063" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1063</bibl>; 3, 989 et saep.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. Sanscr. root tarsh-, to be dry, thirsty; Lat. torreo, torris; Germ Durst; Engl. thirst; prop. the dry land</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the earth</hi>, opp. to the heavens, the sea, the air, etc.; <hi rend="ital">land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soil</hi> (cf.: tellus, solum). </sense><sense id="n47897.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">principio terra universa cernatur, locata in mediā sede mundi, solida et globosa et undique ipsa in sese nutibus suis conglobata, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra in medio mundo sita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc statum esse hujus totius mundi atque naturae, rotundum ut caelum, terra ut media sit, eaque suā vi nutuque teneatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae motus,</quote> <trans><tr>earthquakes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 18, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 35, 78</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:191 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 191 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res invectae ex terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra continens adventus hostium denuntiat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilia fere ex tribus oppidi partibus mari alluitur: reliqua quarta est, quae aditum habeat a terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui parti (insulae) nulla est objecta terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter terrā petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 40, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse terrā eodem pergit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in terrā atque in tuto loco,</quote> <trans><tr>on solid ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex magnā jactatione terram videns,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: terrā marique, <hi rend="ital">by land and by water</hi> (very freq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:19:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 19, 56</bibl>; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiae terrā marique factae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">the form et terrā et mari is also class.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>, § 96 (B. and K. bracket the first et); 2, 5, 50, § 131; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 29, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,022:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ham. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep 60:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep 60, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:101:4" default="NO">101, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: bellum terrā et mari comparat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Att. 10:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā ac mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Verr. 2:2:2:section=4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marique terrāque usque quāque quaeritat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut terrā aut mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari atque terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari ac terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari terrāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 11, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 52, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura sic ab his investigata est, ut nulla pars caelo, mari, terrā (ut poëtice loquar) praetermissa sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum, quae gignuntur e terrā, stirpes et stabilitatem dant iis, quae sustinent, et ex terrā sucum trahunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num qui nummi exciderunt, ere, tibi, quod sic terram Obtuere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere saxa de terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam crebri ad terram accidebant, quam pira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 38</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in terram statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid in terram defluat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus terrae defigitur arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 290</bibl></cit>; so. terrae (<case>dat.</case>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 318</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 347</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 51, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:133 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 133 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub terris si jura deum,</quote> <trans><tr>in the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 4), 39; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mei sub terras ibit imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera terrae,</quote> <trans><tr>kinds of earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 53, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samia terra,</quote> <trans><tr>Samian pottery clay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 12, 53, § 194</bibl></cit>: terrae filius, <hi rend="ital">son of earth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">human being</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrā orti,</quote> <trans><tr>natives of the soil</tr>, <tr>aborigines</tr>, <tr>autochthones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: cum aquam terramque ab Lacedaemoniis petierunt, <hi rend="ital">water and earth</hi> (as a token of subjection), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 17, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47897.2" n="B" level="2"> Personified, Terra, <hi rend="ital">the Earth</hi>, as a goddess; <cit><quote lang="la">usu. called Tellus, Magna Mater, Ceres, Cybele, etc.: jam si est Ceres a gerendo, Terra ipsa dea est et ita habetur: quae est enim alia Tellus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:299" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 299</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>. 460; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 55" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 55</bibl>; <cb n="TERR" /> 140; 152; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 75</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47897.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">territory</hi> (cf.: regio, plaga, tractus): Laurentis terra, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 762</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 35 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra erilis patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5</bibl></cit>. 2, 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostrā terrā in Apuliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:128" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eā terrā (sc. Sicilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25</bibl></cit> 7, 4 Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> 29, 10, 5; 30, 32, 6; 38, 47 6; 39, 17, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">42, 29, 1: Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 23, 10</bibl></cit> Hispania, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:58:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 58, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pharsalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 11</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quascumque terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui terras incolunt eas, in quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire in aliquas terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cimbri) alias terras petierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit> et saep. — Esp., terrae, <hi rend="ital">the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the world</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia tanta, quanta est in terris,</quote> <trans><tr>in the whole earth</tr>, <tr>in the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid erat in terris, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruberes Viveret in terris te si quis avarior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 2, 9</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aureus hanc vitam in terris Saturnus agebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum cura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>. — Ante-class., also in terrā, <hi rend="ital">in the world</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus nunc in terrā melius est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelestiorem in terrā nullam esse alteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 5, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 51</bibl>.—Hence also the phrase orbis terrarum, <hi rend="ital">the world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the whole world</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all nations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae orbem terrarum implevere famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 36, 13, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia in toto orbe terrarum potentissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus tres testes essent totum orbem terrarum nostro imperio teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; but freq. also orbis terrarum, <hi rend="ital">the world</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the empire of Rome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis terrarum gentiumque omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 103</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">while orbis terrae,</quote> <trans><tr>the globe</tr>, <tr>the earth</tr>, <tr>the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 15, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 41, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but also with ref. to the Roman dominion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:42:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 42, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 3, 10</bibl>; id. Off, 2, 8, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the Senate: publicum orbis terrae consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 7, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. orbis: quoquo hinc asportabitur terrarum, certum est persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: ubi terrarum esses, ne suspicabar quidem, <hi rend="ital">in what country</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">where in the world</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 10, 4</bibl>, so, ubi terrarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 13, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:55:section=143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 55, § 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terracina: <entryFree id="n47898" type="main" key="Terra^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Terrăcīna</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Terrăcīnensis</orth>, v Tarracina.</entryFree>
terralisherba: <entryFree id="n47899" type="hapax" key="terra_lis herba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrālis herba</orth>, <sense id="n47899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> sisymbrium, <hi rend="ital">water-cresses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terrenus: <entryFree id="n47900" type="main" key="terre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terra</etym>. <sense id="n47900.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Consisting of earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthen</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n47900.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 850</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 160</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47900.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst..</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">terrēnum</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:8" default="NO">3, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 164</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47900.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the globe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrestrial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrene</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">terrena concretaque corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora nostra terreno principiorum genere confecta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrena et umida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">marini terrenique umores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiarum terrenae sunt aliae, partim aquatiles,</quote> <trans><tr>that live on land</tr>, <tr>land-animals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: de perturbationibus caelestibus et maritimis et terrenis non possumus dicere, id <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 7, 16</bibl>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aqua piscibus, ut sicca terrenis convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>a land-journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 19, § 52</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques Bellerophon,</quote> <trans><tr>earthly</tr>, <tr>mortal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina,</quote> <trans><tr>that dwell in the earth</tr>, <tr>earthly</tr>, <tr>terrene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 248</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">earthly</hi> (eccl. Lat.; opp. caelestis): honores terrenos promittit, ut caelestes adimat, Cypr. de Zelo et <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrena ac fragilia haec bona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 22, 14</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47900.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">terrēna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n47900.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Earthly things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable things</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47900.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Land-animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terreo: <entryFree id="n47901" type="main" key="terre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root tras-, trasāmi, tremble; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tre/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n47901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi>,<pb n="1861" /> <cb n="TERR" />  <hi rend="ital">affright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrify.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47901.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class. and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec me ista terrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui urbem totam . . . caede incendiisque terreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum hominem istis mortis aut exsilii minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae malae cogitationes terrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris subita tempestas terret navigantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites . . . alii se abdere, pars territos confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum ad terrendos nostros valuit clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis metu territi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:16" default="NO">9, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem proscriptionis denuntiatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu poenāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in scenā videtis homines consceleratos impulsu deorum terreri Furiarum taedis ardentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrere metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">territus hoste novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 115</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnites maxime territi, ne ab altero exercitu integro intactoque fessi opprimerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terruit urbem, Terruit gentes, grave ne rediret Saeculum Pyrrhae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">territus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 50</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ultro territuri succlamationibus, concurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47901.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47901.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive away by terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scare away</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">profugam per totum terruit orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fures vel falce vel inguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 640</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">has (Nymphas) pastor fugatas terruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:518" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres (harundo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe etiam audacem fugat hoc terretque poëtam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terret ambustus Phaethon avaras Spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47901.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deter by terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frighten</hi> from any action: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem metu gravioris servitii a repetendā libertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si nostros loco depulsos vidisset, quo minus libere hostes insequerentur, terreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 49</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria pessimi proximo bello exempli terrebat, ne rem committerent eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentiā tuā, ne auderent transitum, terruisti, Auct. Pan. ap. Constant. 22: non territus ire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos loqui terrent amplitudine potestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terrestris: <entryFree id="n47902" type="main" key="terrestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n47902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. masc.</hi> terrester, Flor 2, 2, 4; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terra</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the earth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earth-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">land-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrestrial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant animantium genera quattuor, quorum unum divinum atque caeleste, alterum pennigerum et aërium, tertium aquatile, terrestre quartum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiratio rerum caelestium atque terrestrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:30:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 30, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolio, hoc est in terrestri domicilio Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrestris coepulonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">archipirata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populus vere terrester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit> Duk.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>land - forces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <trans><tr>battles by land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>land-journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 6, 6, § 39</bibl></cit>; Auct. B.
