testamentum: <entryFree id="n47965" type="main" key="testa_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>testor</etym>, <sense id="n47965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the publication of a last will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament; a will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testament</hi> (cf. codicilli). </sense><sense id="n47965.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl> (6), 12, 1 sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum est voluntatis nostrae justa sententia de eo, quod quis post mortem suam fieri velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum legere ... obsignare ... facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 18, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:43:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 43, § 111</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenti factio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:11:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 11, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenti factionem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum conscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsignare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">signare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 241</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25, 72</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentorum ruptorum aut ratorum jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constat agnascendo rumpi testamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57, 241</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2:22" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 2, 22</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">irritum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 42, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 2, 46</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentorum subjector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamento cavere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamento esse in triente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripis hereditatem, quae venerat testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:18:section=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex testamento HS. milies relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenta resignare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamento aliquem adoptare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: testamenta nuncupare, <hi rend="ital">to announce</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acknowledge before witnesses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 5</bibl>.—Concerning the three different kinds of testaments (calatis comitiis, per aes ad libram, and in procinctu), and the laws relating to wills in gen., v. Lübker, Real-Lex., s.v. Testamentum, and esp. Rein, Privatr. p. 363 sq.—</sense><sense id="n47965.2" n="II" level="1"> In eccl. Lat: Testamentum vetus et novum, <hi rend="ital">the Old and New Testaments</hi>, cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
testatim: <entryFree id="n47966" type="main" key="testa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>testa</etym>, <sense id="n47966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like sherds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in bits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fragments</hi> (ante-class.): comminuere, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 178, 25</bibl>: caput alicui, Inv. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
testatio: <entryFree id="n47967" type="main" key="testa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testātĭo</orth>, ōnis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>testor</etym>. <sense id="n47967.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bearing witness</hi> (whether orally or in writing), <hi rend="ital">a giving testimony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attesting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testifying</hi> (not in Cic., but cf. testificatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:4:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:21" default="NO">3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:9" default="NO">48, 19, 9</bibl>; 48, 10, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:49" default="NO">5, 13, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:5 al" default="NO">12, 3, 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47967.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A calling to witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invoking as witness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter foederum ruptorum testationem,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>during an invocation of the gods as witnesses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
testato: <entryFree id="n47968" type="main" key="testa_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. testor <sense id="n47968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
testator: <entryFree id="n47969" type="main" key="testa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>testor</etym>. <sense id="n47969.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who bears witness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testifies</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">a witness</hi> (very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47969.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who makes a will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a testator</hi> (the predom. jurid. signif. of the word, but not in Cic.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:89" default="NO">31, 1, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 20 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
testatrix: <entryFree id="n47970" type="main" key="testa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>testator, II.</etym>, <sense id="n47970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that makes a will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a testatrix</hi>, <cb n="TEST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:35" default="NO">31, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:89" default="NO">31, 1, 89</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 36, 3, 18, § 1.</sense></entryFree>
testatus: <entryFree id="n47971" type="main" key="testa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of testor.</entryFree>
testeus: <entryFree id="n47972" type="main" key="teste^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>testa</etym>, <sense id="n47972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of earthen materials</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthen</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">testea terrenaque corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indumentum animi (corpus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: fragmen, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 5, 553: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
testiculari: <entryFree id="n47973" type="gloss" key="testi^cu^la_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭcŭlāri</orth> <itype>est jumentis maribus feminas vel mares feminis admovere, licet alii dicant testilari</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=366" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 366</bibl> Müll. [testiculus; v. 2. testis].</entryFree>
testiculatus: <entryFree id="n47974" type="main" key="testi^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>testiculus</etym>, <sense id="n47974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having testicles.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47974.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi (opp. spadones),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47974.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭcŭ-lata</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> mercurialis <hi rend="ital">and</hi> orchion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
testiculus: <entryFree id="n47975" type="main" key="testi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. testis</etym>, <sense id="n47975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a testicle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47975.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 20, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:339" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 339</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:24:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47975.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a designation of <hi rend="ital">manly vigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manliness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec fierent, si testiculi vena ulla paterni Viveret in nobis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:103" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 103</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47975.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
testificatio: <entryFree id="n47976" type="main" key="testi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>testificor</etym>, <sense id="n47976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">giving testimony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testification</hi> (Ciceron.; whereas testatio is found in the jurists and in Quint.; v. testatio, I.). </sense><sense id="n47976.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ejus rei testificatio tolleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:42:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 42, § 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 39, § 102</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47976.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a giving evidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attestation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egit causam tuam . . . cum summā testificatione tuorum in se officiorum et amoris erga te sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sempiterna repudiatae legationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
testificor: <entryFree id="n47977" type="main" key="testi^fi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n47977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [1. testisfacio].—</sense><sense id="n47977.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bear witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give evidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testify</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic.; cf. testor). </sense><sense id="n47977.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum maxime testificaretur, in vincula conjectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:7:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 7, § 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testificantur illi Quinctium non stitisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6</bibl></cit>. 25; <cit><quote lang="la">testificor, denuntio, ante praedico, nihil M. Antonium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet Te memorem dominae testificere tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 270</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testificaris, quid dixerim aliquando aut scripserim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 11, 33</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statim testificati discederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 16, 45</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47977.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">publish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to light</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">testificabar sententiam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctam lenitatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicto non longam sui absentiam fore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: antiquas opes. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:302" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 302</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitis adventum dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:240" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 240</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">natalem tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47977.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To call to witness</hi> (rare); deos hominesque amicitiamque nostram testificor, me tibi praedixisse, etc., Cael. ap <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl>, A. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">homines, deam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygiae numen aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:250" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 250</bibl></cit>.— Hence,?*! <orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nota fuit et abs te aliquando testificata tua voluntas omittendae provinciae,</quote> <trans><tr>made known</tr>, <tr>averred</tr>, <tr>exhibited</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira sed et scaenā testificata loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:326" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 326</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
testimonialis: <entryFree id="n47978" type="main" key="testi^mo_ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭmōnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>testimonium</etym>, <sense id="n47978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">serving for evidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testimonial</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n47978.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n47978.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">te-stĭmōnĭāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. litterae), <hi rend="ital">testimonials</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 20, 12; 7, 21, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
testimonium: <entryFree id="n47979" type="main" key="testi^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>testor</etym>, <sense id="n47979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attestation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testimony</hi> (oral or written): <cit><quote lang="la">qui falsas lites falsis testimoniis Petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonii dictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum egregiam fuisse virtutem testimonio Ciceronis cognoverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium in aliquem dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 102</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium dicere de conjuratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium dicere contra deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid pro testimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonium impertire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruttiano justissimum integritatis testimonium redditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: licet <cb n="TEST" /> iis testimonium reddere industriae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publio tuo neque operā ... neque testimonio defui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legite testimonia testium vestrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 17, 46</bibl></cit>: testimonia recitare, Hadrian. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:3:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 5, 3, § 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">falsi testes, falsa signa testimoniaque et indicia ex eādem officinā exibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocare aliquem ad testimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citare ad testimonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in testimonium citare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis damnata falso testimonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47979.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which serves as proof</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evidence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc interest inter exemplum et testimonium: exemplo demonstratur, id quod dicimus cujusmodi sit: testimonio, esse illud ita, ut nos dicimus, confirmatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimoniorum quae sunt genera? Divinum et humanum: divinum, ut oracula, ut auspicia, ut vaticinationes et responsa sacerdotum, haruspicum, conjectorum: humanum, quod spectatur ex auctoritate et ex voluntate et ex oratione aut liberā aut expressā: in quo insunt scripta, pacta, promissa, jurata, quaesita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare testimonium sui judicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">laudum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris sui periculique afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus rei testimonium esse, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus rei ipsa verba formulae testimonio sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui rei mors indigna Palamedis testimonium dat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 28</bibl></cit>: quod testimonio sit, non ex verbis aptum pendere jus, sed, etc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 18, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam, quae voluerat, dixerat, testimonii loco librum tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonio sunt clarissimi poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arca testimonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40, 5</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
testis: <entryFree id="n47980" type="main" key="testis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (<sense id="n47980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum teste vocat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 6, 576</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">one who attests</hi> any thing (orally or in writing), <hi rend="ital">a witness</hi> (cf. superstes): <cit><quote lang="la">testes vinctos attines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluris est oculatus testis unus quam auriti decem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos absentes testes memoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vosque, dii, testes facio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos hominesque se testes facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deūm, quos testes foederum invocabant consules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut manus ad caelum tendens deos testes ingrati animi Magnetum invocaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 31, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:51:12" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 51, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud me ut apud bonum judicem argumenta plus quam testes valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si negem ... quo me teste convinces?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis idonei testes et conscii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cupidi, conjurati et ab religione remoti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incorrupti atque integri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves, leves,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dabo tibi testis nec nimis antiquos nec ullo modo barbaros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">testes dare in aliquam rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 23, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citare in aliquam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>, §146: <cit><quote lang="la">ut iis testibus in summā pecuniae uteretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testibus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:98" default="NO">9, 2, 98</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">dependent-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis faciet ilico, Vendidisse me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis utimini testibus appropinquare eorum adventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 90</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus Cyrenensis, testem te testor mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teste deā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl></cit> (17), 124: <cit><quote lang="la">nutrix testis fida doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oct. 76" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oct. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musa mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:9:50" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 9, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inductā teste in senatu, Haec, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera sunt testes et matutina pruina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid debeas, o Roma Neronibus, Testis Metaurum flumen et Hasdrubal Devictus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis mecum est anulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47980.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an eye-witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectator</hi>, i. q. arbiter (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also conscius): facies bona teste caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puduitque gementem, Illo teste mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:887" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 887</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac lunā teste moventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:311" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 311</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47981" type="main" key="testis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a testicle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexter asini testis in vino potus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 80, § 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes pecori ad crura decidui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 49, 110, § 263</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 235, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 45</bibl>.—In a pun, with 1. testis: <cit><quote lang="la">quod amas, amato testibus praesentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis testibus ista res agetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 2</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">integritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1864" /> <cb n="TEST" /></sense></entryFree>
testitrahus: <entryFree id="n47982" type="hapax" key="testi^tra^hus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testĭtrăhus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. testistraho</etym>, <sense id="n47982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that drags his testicles</hi>: aries, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1</bibl> (Com. Rel. xx. Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
testor: <entryFree id="n47983" type="main" key="testor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. testis</etym>. <sense id="n47983.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be a witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak as witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bear witness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give evidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attest</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n47983.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare, and not in Cic.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">testificor): confiteor: testere licet: signate Quirites,</quote> <trans><tr>thou canst attest it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:15:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi inclamaret aut testaretur locutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:172" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47983.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to make known</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrate; to give to understand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear witness to</hi>, etc. (class and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego quod facio, me pacis, otii, etc. ... causā facere, clamo atque testor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem hujus indicii monumentis publicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc illa testabor, non me sortilegos ... agnoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testatur isto audiente, se pro communi necessitudine id primum petere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 21, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimā voce se nomen Oppianici ... delaturum esse testatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae accidere testatus antea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 61, 10</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">testatus, quae praestitisset civibus eorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal testandi causā publicum agrum esse imponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduoque suos gemitu testata dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Cicero pluribus et libris et epistulis testatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraeque (venae et arteriae) vim quandam incredibilem artificiosi operis divinique testantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt Agamemnonias testantia litora curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 7</bibl></cit> (4, 6), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pura testantur sidera caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba nos testantia gratos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina raros testantia mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:9:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 9, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus sepulcris proelia testatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus autem (saepe enim hoc testandum est) est non modo non poëtice junctus, verum etiam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:227" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 227</bibl></cit>; Quint. prooem. § 26; 11, 1, 5.—</sense><sense id="n47983.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to publish one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s last will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide by will</hi> for any thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:21:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 21, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ignorans nurum ventrem ferre, immemor in testando nepotis decessisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis dubitaret, quin ea voluntas fuisset testantis, ut is non nato filio heres esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si exheredatum a se filium pater testatus fuerit elogio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primipilari seni jam testato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestati appellantur, qui cum possent testamentum facere, testati non sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:19" default="NO">29, 1, 19</bibl> pr.; <cit><quote lang="la">49, 14, 45 pr.: nomen testatas intulit in tabulas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into his will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47983.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To call upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">invoke a</hi> person or thing <hi rend="ital">as witness</hi> (likewise class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Venus Cyrenensis, testem te testor mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, di patrii ac penates, testor, me defendere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 31, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Marii et ceterorum virorum mentis testor, me pro illorum famā propugnandum putare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 30</bibl></cit>: omnes deos, with an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego omnes homines deosque testor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:29:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 29, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos immortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 68, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me potissimum testatus est, se aemulum mearum laudum exstitisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit> stuprata per vim Lucretia a regis filio, testata cives, se ipsa interemit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">implorarem sensus vestros, uniuscujusque indulgentiam in suos testarer, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 23, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulibus deos hominesque testantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem et laesi foederis aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, aeterni ignes, et non violabile vestrum testor numen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theseus infernis, superis testatur Achilles, Hic Ixioniden, ille Menoetiaden,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:37" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volnera testor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:885" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 885</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id testor deos, Ter Hec. 3, 5, 26: hoc vos, judices, testor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.<figure /> </sense><sense id="n47983.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">testo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n47983.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (acc. to I. B.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliorum monumentis tum Catonis oratione testatum est,</quote> <trans><tr>shown</tr>, <tr>proved</tr>, <tr>attested</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:2" default="NO">2, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>, prooem. § 20.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> force: <orth extent="full" lang="la">testātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">published</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut res quam maxime clara ac testata esse posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76:section=187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76, § 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2</bibl>. 2, 42, § 104; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 16, 48: haec testata sunt atque inlustria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut testatum esse velim, de pace quid senserim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil religione testatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut res multorum oculis esset testatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:27:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 27, 64</bibl></cit>: quo notior <cb n="TETA" /> testatiorque virtus ejus esset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:42" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo testatior esset poena improborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testatissima miracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">testātō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">before witnesses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussum accipiendum est, sive testato quis, sive verbis, aut per nuntium, jusserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 18, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:122" default="NO">45, 1, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 324, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47983.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">As is well known</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47983.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">After making a will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">testate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive testato, sive intestato, decesserint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 14, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
testu: <entryFree id="n47984" type="main" key="testu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testu</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">testum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>testa</etym>, <sense id="n47984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lid</hi> which was placed over food, etc., to be cooked, and then covered with hot coals, usually of earthenware. </sense><sense id="n47984.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foco caldo sub testu coquito leniter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub testu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et fumant testu pressus uterque suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:510" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimo ovium sub testo calefacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguito focum, ubi coquas, colfacito bene et testum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> testo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">84, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 51</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Afterwards of metal: ranarum corda sub aereo testo discoxere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 26, § 81</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47984.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an earthen vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthen pot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara fit: huc ignem curto fert rustica testu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:645" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 645</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl>; Mumm. and Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 118</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
testuatium: <entryFree id="n47985" type="hapax" key="testu^a_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testŭātĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>testu</etym>, <sense id="n47985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cake baked in an earthen cup</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cup-cake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=106" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 106</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
testudineatus: <entryFree id="n47986" type="main" key="testu_di^ne^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testūdĭnĕātus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">testūdĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>testudo, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n47986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vaulted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavaedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
testudineus: <entryFree id="n47987" type="main" key="testu_di^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testūdĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>testudo, I. and-II.</etym>, <sense id="n47987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a tortoise; made of tortoise-shell</hi>: gradus, <hi rend="ital">a tortoise-pace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snail</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s pace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 10</bibl>: lyra, <hi rend="ital">made of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">overlaid with tortoise-shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:2:22" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conopeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hexaclinon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:60:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 60, 9</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui testudinea legata essent, ei lectos testudineos pedibus inargentatos deberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:100:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 100, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
testudo: <entryFree id="n47988" type="main" key="testu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>testa</etym>, <sense id="n47988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tortoise.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47988.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 4, 14, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 52, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 121:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 121, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:6:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 6, 5 al.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">testudo volat, of any thing impossible,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 352</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47988.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tortoise-shell.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47988.3" n="A" level="2"> Used for overlaying or veneering, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 463</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:66:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 66, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:308" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 308</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47988.4" n="B" level="2"> From the arched shape of a tortoise-shell. </sense><sense id="n47988.5" n="1" level="3"> Of any stringed instrument of music of an arched shape, <hi rend="ital">a lyre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cithern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 464</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 395</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:187" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:277" default="NO">1, 277</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47988.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An arch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vault</hi> in buildings (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fornix, camera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl></cit>, §§ 79 and 161 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:6:4" default="NO">3, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 87</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 58, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 505</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47988.7" n="3" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a tortoise</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelter</hi> so called (cf.: vinea, pluteus), viz., </sense><sense id="n47988.8" n="a" level="4"> Made of wood, for the protection of besiegers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19 sq.</bibl> — </sense><sense id="n47988.9" n="b" level="4"> Formed of the shields of the soldiers held over their heads, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 39, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 505</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 514 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n47988.10" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The covering of the hedgehog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:86:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 86, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47988.11" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A head-dress</hi> in imitation of a lyre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Fur. 886" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 886</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Cap.</author> 9</bibl>, §§ 935 and 941; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48003.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: anni, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the four seasons</hi>, Varr ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 71, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

tetraptota: <entryFree id="n48020" type="greek" key="te_^trapto_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^traptōta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tetra/ptwta,</foreign> <sense id="n48020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">words which occur in only four cases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tetraptotes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 6, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tetrapus: <entryFree id="n48021" type="greek" key="Te_^tra^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tē^trăpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tetra/pous</foreign> (four-footed), <sense id="n48021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of the eighth book of Apicius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which treats of the dishes prepared from quadrupeds.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tetrarches: <entryFree id="n48022" type="greek" key="te_^trarches"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^trarches</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tetra/rxhs,</foreign> <sense id="n48022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ruler who governed the fourth part of a country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tetrarch;</hi> in gen., <hi rend="ital">the title of a petty prince</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11</bibl>, <pb n="1865" /> <cb n="TEUT" /> 12, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl>.—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^trar-cha</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

B. Alex. 78, 3.</sense></entryFree>
tetras: <entryFree id="n48024" type="greek" key="te_^tras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^tras</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tetra/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number four</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quaternion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tetrad</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 734</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tetrasemus: <entryFree id="n48025" type="greek" key="te_^tra^se_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^trăsēmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tetra/shmos,</foreign> <sense id="n48025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of four syllables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quadrisyllabic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <trans><tr>a poetical foot of four syllables</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 987</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tetrastichos: <entryFree id="n48026" type="greek" key="te_^trasti^chos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^trastĭchos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tetra/stixos,</foreign> <sense id="n48026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing four rows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lines.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48026.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: porticus, Treb. Gall. 18. —</sense><sense id="n48026.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^-trastĭchon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a poem of four verses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tetrastich</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 96</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:85:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 85, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tetrastylos: <entryFree id="n48027" type="greek" key="te_^trasty_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^trastȳlos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tetra/stulos,</foreign> <sense id="n48027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having four columns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48027.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cava aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48027.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^trastȳlon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a building with four columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tetrastyle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2270</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tetre: <entryFree id="n48028" type="main" key="te_tre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tētrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. teter <sense id="n48028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tetrica: <entryFree id="n48029" type="main" key="Te^tri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕtrĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rocky mountain in the Sabine territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in wild goats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 713</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Tetrica rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:419" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 419</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tetricitas: <entryFree id="n48030" type="main" key="te_^tri^ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^trĭcĭtas</orth>, v. taetricitas.</entryFree>

Carm. Philom. 22.</sense></entryFree>
tetritudo: <entryFree id="n48033" type="main" key="te_^tri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē^trĭtūdo</orth>, v. taetritudo.</entryFree>

tettigonia: <entryFree id="n48036" type="greek" key="tetti_go^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tettīgŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tettigo/nia,</foreign> <sense id="n48036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small cicada</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 26, 32, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tetuli: <entryFree id="n48037" type="main" key="te^tu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕtŭli</orth>, v. fero <sense id="n48037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
teucer: <entryFree id="n48038" type="main" key="Teucer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucer</orth>, <itype>cri</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Teucrus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*teu=kros.</foreign> <sense id="n48038.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Telamon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Salamis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Ajax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 24</bibl>; 4, 9, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 157</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 698</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48038.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Scamander of Crete</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son-in-law of Dardanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards king of Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 705</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 108</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48038.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teu-crus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Teu cer;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf. for <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 345</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Trojans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 248</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 705</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 728 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:348" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 348</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48038.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teu-crĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <trans><tr>of Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:36" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 36</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n48038.4" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Trojan country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48038.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n48038.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A Trojan female.</hi> captivae, Sabin. 1, 81.—</sense><sense id="n48038.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A pseudonymic designation of some person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teucris illa lentum sane negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teuchites: <entryFree id="n48039" type="greek" key="teuchi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">teuchītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teuxi/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fragrant rush</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 72, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teucri: <entryFree id="n48040" type="main" key="Teucri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Teucer, II. 1. and 2. b.</entryFree>
teucrion: <entryFree id="n48041" type="greek" key="teucri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">teucrĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teu/krion.</foreign> <sense id="n48041.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the germander</hi>: Teucrium chamaedrys, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl> (al. Teucria).—</sense><sense id="n48041.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The herb spleenwort</hi>: Teucrium flavium, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 20, § 45</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">teucrĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 19, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teucris: <entryFree id="n48042" type="main" key="Teucris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucris</orth>, ĭdis; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teucrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Teucer.</entryFree>
teus: <entryFree id="n48043" type="main" key="Te^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v Teos.</entryFree>
teuta: <entryFree id="n48044" type="main" key="Teuta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a queen of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 11, § 24</bibl>. — Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutāna</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutani: <entryFree id="n48045" type="main" key="Teuta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of the Peloponnesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutates: <entryFree id="n48046" type="main" key="Teuta_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity of the Gauls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom human sacrifices were offered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 445</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teuthalis: <entryFree id="n48047" type="greek" key="teutha^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">teuthălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teuqali/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> sanguinaria <hi rend="ital">and</hi> polygonos. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 91, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teuthras: <entryFree id="n48048" type="main" key="Teuthras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuthras</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*teu/qras.</foreign> <sense id="n48048.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Mysia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Thespius</hi>, Hyg. <cb n="TEXT" /> Fab. 99 and 100.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48048.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuthran-tēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Teuthras;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Mysian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 243</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48048.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuthrantĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Teuthras</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans><tr>the daughters of Thespius</tr>, <tr>a son of Teuthras</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48048.3" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teuthrānĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Teu-thrānĭē</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the territory in Mysia ruled by Teuthras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 85, 87, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:125" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 30, 33, § 125</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n48048.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Campania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48048.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a Trojan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 402</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teuticus: <entryFree id="n48049" type="main" key="Teuti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Illyrian chief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutobodiaci: <entryFree id="n48050" type="main" key="Teutobodiaci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutobodiaci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Galatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutoburgiensis: <entryFree id="n48051" type="main" key="Teutoburgiensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutoburgiensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the citadel of the Teutones</hi>: saltus, <hi rend="ital">a forest of Western Germany in which Varus was defeated</hi> A. D. 9, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutomatus: <entryFree id="n48052" type="main" key="Teutomatus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutomatus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Nitiobriges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teutoni: <entryFree id="n48053" type="main" key="Teuto^ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutŏni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Teutŏ-nes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:12:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 67" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 5, 1 sq.</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Teutons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:7" default="NO">3, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:20:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 20, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
