themison: <entryFree id="n48118" type="main" key="The^mi^son"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕmĭson</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qemi/swn,</foreign> <sense id="n48118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated physician of Laodicea in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:221" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 221</bibl>; Cels. Praef. al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
themista: <entryFree id="n48119" type="main" key="The^mista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕmista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female Epicurean philosopher of Lampsacus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 26, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 25, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
themistocles: <entryFree id="n48120" type="main" key="The^misto^cles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕmistŏcles</orth>, <itype>i and is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qemistoklh=s,</foreign> <sense id="n48120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Athenian commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose life is written by Nepos;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:74:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 74, 300</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 86, 351</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 16, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:32:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 32, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 1, 1</bibl> sqq.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕmistŏclēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Themistocles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thensaurus: <entryFree id="n48121" type="main" key="thensaurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thensaurus</orth>, v. thesaurus.</entryFree>
theocritus: <entryFree id="n48122" type="main" key="The^o_^cri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕō^crĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeo/kritos,</foreign> <sense id="n48122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated Grecian idyllic poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Verg. p. 53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Verg. p. 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theodamas: <entryFree id="n48123" type="main" key="The_o^da^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēŏdămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeioda/mas,</foreign> <sense id="n48123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of the Dryopes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Hylas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:271" default="NO">271</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēŏdă-mantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Theodamas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Theodamantean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hylas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the son of Theodamas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 6</bibl></cit> (Thiodamanteus, Müll.).</sense></entryFree>
theodectes: <entryFree id="n48124" type="main" key="The^o^dectes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏdectes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeode/kths,</foreign> <sense id="n48124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek orator of Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Isocrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Aristotle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:172" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">57, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">64, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14</bibl>, ext. 3.</sense></entryFree>
theodorus: <entryFree id="n48125" type="main" key="The^o^do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏdōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeo/dwros.</foreign> <sense id="n48125.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek sophist of Byzantium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48125.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek atheist of Cyrene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 40, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 14:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 14, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48125.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated rhetorician of Gadara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:26" default="NO">3, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 57</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕ-ŏdōrēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil and follower of Theodorus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:18" default="NO">3, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theodosia: <entryFree id="n48126" type="main" key="The^o^do^sia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏdŏsia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Tauric Chersonese</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Caffa</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Feodosia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theognis: <entryFree id="n48127" type="main" key="The^ognis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕognis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qe/ognis,</foreign> <sense id="n48127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient Greek poet;</hi> hence, as a designation of a very ancient period: etiam priusquam Theognis nasceretur, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theogonia: <entryFree id="n48128" type="greek" key="The^o^go^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏgŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeogoni/a</foreign> (the Origin of the Gods), <sense id="n48128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a poem by Hesiod</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 14, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theologia: <entryFree id="n48129" type="greek" key="the^o^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeologi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">theology</hi>, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 5. <cb n="THER" /></sense></entryFree>
theologicus: <entryFree id="n48130" type="greek" key="the^o^lo^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕŏlŏgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeologiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to theology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theological</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: metrum, <hi rend="ital">heroic verse</hi>, Plot. 2629 P.</sense></entryFree>
theologumena: <entryFree id="n48131" type="greek" key="The^o^lo^gu_me^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏlŏgūmĕna</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeologou/mena,</foreign> <sense id="n48131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speculations on divine things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work by Aristotle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 18, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theologus: <entryFree id="n48132" type="greek" key="the^o^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeolo/gos,</foreign> <sense id="n48132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who treats of the deity</hi> and <hi rend="ital">of divine things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a theologian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:53 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 53 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theombrotios: <entryFree id="n48133" type="greek" key="the^ombro_ti^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕombrōtĭos</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qewmbrw/tion,</foreign> <sense id="n48133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 166</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theon: <entryFree id="n48134" type="main" key="The^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n48134.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A satirical <usg type="style">poet.</usg></hi>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕōnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Theon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 82</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48134.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Samian painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theophane: <entryFree id="n48135" type="main" key="The^o^pha^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏphănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeofa/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n48135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Bisaltes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loved by Poseidon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 188" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 188</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theophanes: <entryFree id="n48136" type="main" key="The^o^pha^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏphănes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeofanh/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek historian of Mitylene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
theophilus: <entryFree id="n48137" type="main" key="The^o^phi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏphĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeo/filos,</foreign> <sense id="n48137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freedman of M. Marcellus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theophrastus: <entryFree id="n48138" type="main" key="The^ophrastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕophrastus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeo/frastos,</foreign> <sense id="n48138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek philosopher of Eressus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Plato and Aristotle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:28:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 28, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theopompos: <entryFree id="n48139" type="main" key="The^o^pompos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏpompos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeo/pompos,</foreign> <sense id="n48139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek historian and orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Isocrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 94</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 1</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕŏ-pompēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Theopompus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Theopompean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theopompino genere (dicendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Theopompeo more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 61, 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
theorema: <entryFree id="n48140" type="greek" key="the^o_re_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕōrēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qew/rhma,</foreign> <sense id="n48140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proposition to be proved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a theorem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:19:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 230</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Dat. plur.</hi> theorematis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theoremation: <entryFree id="n48141" type="greek" key="the^o_re_ma^ti^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕōrēmătĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, = <foreign lang="greek">qewrhma/tion,</foreign> <sense id="n48141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little theorem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theoreticus: <entryFree id="n48142" type="greek" key="the^o_re_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕōrētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qewrhtiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemplative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speculative</hi> (pure Lat. contemplativus; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. practicus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 1, 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theoria: <entryFree id="n48143" type="greek" key="the^o_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qewri/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosophic speculation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theory</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 12, 40, 4</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6, 1</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
theorice: <entryFree id="n48144" type="greek" key="the^o_ri^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕōrĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qewrikh/,</foreign> <sense id="n48144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a philosophic speculation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 30, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theotocos: <entryFree id="n48145" type="greek" key="the^o^to^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕŏtŏcos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qeoto/kos,</foreign> <sense id="n48145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Godbearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of God</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">theotocos virgo Maria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thera: <entryFree id="n48146" type="main" key="The_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Thērē</orth>, ēs), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qh/ra,</foreign> <sense id="n48146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chief of the Sporades</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Santorin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 87, 89, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 23, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 21, 1</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thera</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:139" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyperos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 70, § 117</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēraei</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Theræans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theramenes: <entryFree id="n48147" type="main" key="The_ra_me^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thērāmĕnes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qhrame/nhs,</foreign> <sense id="n48147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the thirty tyrants of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was put to death for resisting the oppressive measures of his associates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
therapnae: <entryFree id="n48148" type="main" key="The^rapnae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕrapnae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Thĕramnae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qera/pnai,</foreign> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qera/pnh,</foreign> <sense id="n48148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Laconia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Helen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:53" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 53</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thĕ-rapnaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Thĕramn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Therapnæ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Therapnæan;</hi> in the poets for <hi rend="ital">Laconian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 196: <cit><quote lang="la">marita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Helen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:793" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 793</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">membra Therapnaea resolutus gymnade Pollux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amyclae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:104:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 104, 5</bibl></cit>.—And, as the Tarentines were an off-shoot from the Laconians, sometimes also for <hi rend="ital">Tarentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galesus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:111" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 111</bibl></cit>.—For the same reason, also for <hi rend="ital">Sabine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine Clausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:414" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 414</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
therasia: <entryFree id="n48149" type="main" key="The_ra^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thērăsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qhrasi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite to Thea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">westward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still called Therasia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 87, 89, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 23, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 21, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48149.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lipari islands near Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Vulcanello</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 9, 14, § 93</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 648</bibl>. <cb n="THER" /></sense></entryFree>
theriacus: <entryFree id="n48150" type="greek" key="the_ri^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thērĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qhriako/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good against the poison of animals</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">against the bite of serpents.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48150.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 21, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 28, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48150.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">thērĭăca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an antidote against the bite of serpents</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">against poison</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 24, 100, § 264</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 1, 8, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 163" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 163</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thericles: <entryFree id="n48151" type="main" key="The_ricles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēricles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qhriklh=s,</foreign> <sense id="n48151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous potter of Grecian antiquity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 40, 76, § 205</bibl> (from Theophr. Hist. Plant. 5, 4).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēriclēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thericles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thericlean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
therionarca: <entryFree id="n48152" type="greek" key="the_ri^o^narca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thērĭŏnarca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qhriona/rkh,</foreign> <sense id="n48152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant which benumbs serpents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:113" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 65, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
theristrum: <entryFree id="n48153" type="greek" key="the^ristrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thĕristrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qe/ristron,</foreign> <sense id="n48153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a summer garment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48153.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 2, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 38, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48153.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">theristrum pudicitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thermae: <entryFree id="n48154" type="greek" key="thermae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thermae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. aquae), = <foreign lang="greek">qerma\ u(/data,</foreign> <sense id="n48154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warm springs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warm baths</hi> (natural or artificial; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tepula aqua): Agrippae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:26" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 4, 9, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:189" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 25, 64, § 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:34:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 34, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:84:5" default="NO">12, 84, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48154.1" n="B" level="2"> = thermopolium, q. v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 168</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48154.2" n="II" level="1"> As <hi rend="ital">nom. prop.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermae</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qe/rmai,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a town in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Himera</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Termini</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=85 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 85 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:232" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 232</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermitānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Thermæ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thermitan</hi>: homo, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Thermæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermi-tāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Thermæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:42:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 42, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thermaicus: <entryFree id="n48155" type="main" key="Therma^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermăĭcus</orth>, v. Therme.</entryFree>
thermanticus: <entryFree id="n48156" type="greek" key="thermanti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thermantĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qermantiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves for warming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">warming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 120</bibl></cit>: unctiones, Pelag. Vet. 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
thermapalus: <entryFree id="n48157" type="greek" key="therma^pa^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thermăpălus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qerma/palos</foreign> ( <foreign lang="greek">qermo/s-a(palo/s</foreign> ), <sense id="n48157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">warm and soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
therme: <entryFree id="n48158" type="main" key="Therme_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qe/rmh,</foreign> <sense id="n48158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards Thessalonica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48158.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ther-maeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Therme</hi>: sinus, <hi rend="ital">the Thermaic Gulf</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">il Golfo di Salonichi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48158.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qermai+ko/s,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of Therme</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
therminus: <entryFree id="n48159" type="greek" key="thermi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thermĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">qe/rminos,</foreign> <sense id="n48159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of lupines</hi> (horse-beans): <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 49, § 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
termitanus: <entryFree id="n48160" type="main" key="Termita_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Termitānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. thermae, II.</entryFree>
thermodon: <entryFree id="n48161" type="main" key="Thermo_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermōdon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qermw/dwn,</foreign> <sense id="n48161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which dwelt the Amazons</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Termeh Tchai</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 3, 4, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 659</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 4, 71; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:432" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48161.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermōdon-tēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Thermodon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thermodontean;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Amazonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 13), 14 (Müll. Thermodontiacis).—</sense><sense id="n48161.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermōdontĭ-ăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">turmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:56" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipennis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Penthesilea</tr>, <tr>the queen of the Amazons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 611</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">securis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>of Hippolyte</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 189</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48161.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermō-dontĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 215" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thermopolium: <entryFree id="n48162" type="greek" key="thermo^po_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thermŏpōlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qermopw/lion,</foreign> <sense id="n48162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where warm drinks were sold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pothouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tap-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tavern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thermopoto: <entryFree id="n48163" type="greek" key="thermo^po_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thermŏpōto</orth>, <itype>āvi, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>vox hibrida, <foreign lang="greek">qermo/s</foreign>-poto</etym>, <sense id="n48163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to refresh with warm potations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutturem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
thermopylae: <entryFree id="n48164" type="main" key="Thermo^py^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermŏpylae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qermopu/lai,</foreign> <sense id="n48164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the famous defile of Œta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Leonidas fell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus Thermopylarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 58, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thermospodium: <entryFree id="n48165" type="greek" key="thermospo^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thermospŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qermospo/dion,</foreign> <sense id="n48165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glowing ashes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
thermulae: <entryFree id="n48166" type="hapax" key="thermu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thermŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>thermae</etym>, <sense id="n48166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little warm bath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 42, 1</bibl>. <pb n="1868" /> <cb n="THES" /></sense></entryFree>
thermus: <entryFree id="n48167" type="main" key="Thermus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thermus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen in the Minucian</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Minucius Thermus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
therodamas: <entryFree id="n48168" type="main" key="The_ro^da^mas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thērŏdămas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qhroda)mas</foreign> (beast-feeder), <sense id="n48168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fed lions with human flesh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:121" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 121</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thērŏdămantēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Therodamas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Therodamantean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:385" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 385</bibl></cit> (others read, in both places, Theromedon, Theromedonteus.)</sense></entryFree>
thersites: <entryFree id="n48169" type="main" key="Thersi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thersītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qersi/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n48169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek before Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous for his ugliness and scurrility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:9:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 31</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">a contemptible person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:269" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 269</bibl>; and for <hi rend="ital">a calumniator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reviler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:23:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 23, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thesaurarius: <entryFree id="n48170" type="hapax" key="the_saura_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thēsaurārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>thesaurus</etym>, <sense id="n48170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to treasure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fures,</quote> <trans><tr>treasure-thieves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">thēsaurārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">treasure</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 21, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thesaurensis: <entryFree id="n48171" type="hapax" key="the_saurensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thēsaurensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treasure-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treasurer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 24, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thesaurizator: <entryFree id="n48172" type="main" key="the_sauriza_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thēsaurizātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>thesaurizo</etym>, <sense id="n48172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lays up treasure</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Interp. Orig. in Jer. Hom. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thesaurizo: <entryFree id="n48173" type="main" key="the_saurizo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thēsaurizo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n48173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [thesaurus], <hi rend="ital">to gather</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay up treasure</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n48173.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,050:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Bar. 3, 18</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48173.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to treasure up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: iram, id. Gub. Dei, 5, 9; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 5, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thesaurochrysonicochrysides: <entryFree id="n48174" type="main" key="The_sauro^chry_so^ni_cochry_si^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēsaurŏchrȳsŏnīcochrȳsĭdes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Thens-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a facetiously-formed proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thesaurus: <entryFree id="n48175" type="greek" key="the_saurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thēsaurus</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">thensaurus</orth>, Plaut. Trin. prol. p. ciii. Ritschl; cf. Marin. Fratr. Arv. p. 590; collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">thensau-rum</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46, 8</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qhsauro/s.</foreign> <sense id="n48175.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing laid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stored up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hoard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">store.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48175.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">TABVLARIVS THENSAVRORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thensaurum effodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesaurum defodere ... invenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:65:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 65, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero quemquam senem audivi oblitum, quo loco thesaurum obruisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non exercitus neque thensauri praesidia regni sunt, verum amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactis opulentior Thesauris Arabum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48175.2" n="2" level="3"> Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">treasure trove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thensaurus est vetus quaedam depositio pecuniae, cujus non exstat memoria, ut jam dominum non habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:31:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 31, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:3:section=3" default="NO">41, 2, 3, § 3</bibl>; Cod. 10, 15, 1.— </sense><sense id="n48175.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">thesaurus mali,</quote> <trans><tr>a great quantity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: stupri, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 19</bibl>; cf.: augent ex pauxillo; <cit><quote lang="la">thensaurum inde pariunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesauros penitus abditae fraudis vultu laeto tegentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 165, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48175.4" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">a treasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loved one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a valued</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dear object: Di.</hi> Quid, amator novos quispiam? <hi rend="ital">Ast.</hi> Integrum et plenum adortust thensaurum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eccum lenonem, incedit, thensaurum meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">thensaurus copiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48175.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place where any thing is stored up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a storehouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treasure - chamber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treasure - vault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treasury</hi> (cf.: cella, armarium). </sense><sense id="n48175.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">monedula condens semina in thesauros cavernarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 22, § 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the cells of bees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 229</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonent quidam, esse thesaurum publicum sub terrā saxo quadrato septum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Proserpinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 12, 1</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of <hi rend="ital">the Lower World</hi>: postquam est Orcino traditus thesauro, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48175.7" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a strong-box</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treasure-chest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum thesaurum effregisset heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apertis thesauris suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48175.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a repository</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conservatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magazine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collection</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dicam de thesauro rerum omnium, memoria?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">thesauri argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:31:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 31, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppeditat nobis Atticus noster de thesauris suis quos et quantos viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 67</bibl></cit>: thesauros oportet esse non libros, Plin. praef. § 17; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quoties aliquid abditum quaero, ille thesaurus est,</quote> <trans><tr>a literary storehouse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48175.9" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a Greek play by Philemon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon which Plautus founded the Trinummus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. 18</bibl>. <cb n="THES" /></sense></entryFree>
theseus: <entryFree id="n48176" type="main" key="The_seus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēseus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĕï</orth>;, and  <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĕos</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qhseu/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Ægeus</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">of Neptune</hi>) <hi rend="ital">and Æthra; husband of Ariadne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards of Phædra; father of Hippolytus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the Amazon Hippolyte; friend of Pirithoüs; conqueror of the highway-robbers Periphetes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sinnis</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">and of the Minotaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:433 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 433 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:576" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 576</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 31, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14</bibl> (3, 6), 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:737" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 618</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:27 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 27 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48176.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēsēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Theseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thesean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the desertion of Ariadne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:460" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 460</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 459</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">Athenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">Hymettus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:104:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 104, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48176.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thē-sēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Theseus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hippolytus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:681" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troezen,</quote> <trans><tr>ruled by the ancestors of Theseus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48176.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēsīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the offspring of Theseus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hippolytus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 20</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">an Athenian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 383</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48176.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Thēsēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the title of a poem concerning Theseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
thesion: <entryFree id="n48177" type="greek" key="the_si_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">thēsīon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">qhsei=on,</foreign> <sense id="n48177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bastard toad - flax</hi>: Thesium linophyllum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 67, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:66" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 31, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
